subject: Productivity
title: Smartphones and Time Fragmentation
description: Learn Smartphones and Time Fragmentation in one minute.

hook.text: The average person picks up their phone 96 times a day. Each pickup fractures attention.

buildup.text: Smartphones blurred the boundary between work and rest. The office now fits in every pocket.

discovery.text: Researchers found that merely having a phone visible on a desk reduces cognitive performance.

twist.text: Notifications create a state of continuous partial attention. You're never fully here or there.

climax.text: Some companies now enforce phone-free meeting rooms. Focus requires physical boundaries.

punchline.text: Your phone is a time machine. It steals yours.

quiz.question: What did researchers find about having a phone visible on a desk?
